messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Are you there?
9-1-1, do you need police, fire, or EMS?
We have been shot at! Our house is under fire. We have three children, we need someone here now!
Alright, ma'am. I need you to stay on the line with me. Can you verify your address for me, please?
1733 Pierpont.
What's the phone number you're calling from?
We do not know where this person is. They have a gun and they shot at our house.
Ma'am, listen to me. Get on the floor. I need to get some information for the officers, okay?
What's the phone number you're calling from?
It's my cell phone.
Okay, what's your name?
Jennifer Griffith.
Tell me exactly what happened, please.
We heard a loud noise, like a boom, boom, boom, and then someone shot at us.
Someone was inside your house?
No, they're outside, but our windows have been shot through. We have our children in our room.
Okay, I need you to stay in the room with your children. When did this happen?
It just happened. Somebody needs to get here right now.
Jennifer, help is on the way. This isn't slowing anyone down, okay? Where are the weapons now?
We don't have any weapons. Somebody was shooting at us from outside.
Do you see any weapons now? If you do not know, that's fine.
My husband says he's shot.
Okay, I'm getting the paramedics to you now. I need you to answer these questions for your safety and the officers. You don't know where the shooter is, correct?
No, we do not see a weapon or anyone outside now.
Are you in immediate danger?
Yes, I feel we are in immediate danger. We don't know where the shooter is.
Are you able to get yourself to safety?
No, it's not safe for us to leave the house. We can't see outside right now.
Can you talk with me freely, Jennifer?
Yes, I can.
Where exactly are you in the house? What's the best way to get to you?
When you come in the front door, go left down the hallway past the bathroom. We're in the back bedroom to the left.
Okay, you're in the back bedroom to the left, with the door closed, correct?
Yes, we have the door closed.
We have paramedics and officers coming to you. Is anyone else in immediate danger?
My husband is also on the phone with 911. We're all in the same room.
Tell him to disconnect. You're all together, right? Is anyone else in immediate danger?
Yes, there are five of us. We don't know if anyone else is in danger because we don't know where the shooter is.
How many people are injured?
My husband is injured, he's the only one.
Where is the person responsible now?
We have no idea.
Was your husband able to see if the suspect is white, black, or Hispanic? Male or female?
No, he did not see.
Can you stay on the line with me? Your husband should stay in the room.
He has left the room.
Tell him to go back into the room and close the door. Do not leave the room.
He's turning on the porch light now.
Do you see the police? Are they outside?
My husband says he sees a car.
The police are looking for your house. Stay inside.
He's wearing a black shirt and white shorts. Yes, he's talking to them.
Okay, go ahead and speak with the police. They are inside now.
This is 1733 Pierpont.
Sir, I'm right here with you. We've gotten the call.
My wife is here with our three young kids on the floor. We need help right now.
Sir, we're getting help to you. Stay on the line, you don't have to say anything.
